positive.review:
ive been looking for the aliens for weeks.

they still evade me.

edit: i got it an hour later, complain your way to greatness chat

Super fun idle game with a really nice completionist curve right up until the final 100m gold achievement! It's fun going for max all recipies and I like that it's lightweight enough to keep open while playing other games too. The art, animations, and little collabs are really cute also!
I wish that there were a couple QoL features like when selling fish or taking out of the breeding pen you could shift-click and move/take all at once instead of having to click and hold then wait for a little while each time. It would also be nice if meals in the restaurant sold while the game was closed, but I understand having it the way it is currently.
My biggest gripe is with the 100m achievement. Going for full completionist, i had everything fully upgraded, all fish, all rods, full mythic tank etc and this achievement alone added 100h of playtime still.
I imagine that with more updates and areas being added (like the recent halloween one and mythic fish) this curve will seem like less of a cliff, but as it stands this one achievement literally doubled my playtime to get.
Aside from that though, I do highly recommend the game!!
Almost completed all the achievement in 300 hours. What an amazing game, hope they add more fish variety in the future.
super chilled out gameplay, perfect for idling and leaving running in the background while you work!

This is great idle game. I have grown to love the idle games that are on the desktop. What is interesting is that this game has helped me to be more productive in my work. I especially love that when I type, that is an action to speed up the fishing. 
Great idle game that respects your time as well. Plus it is really cute, that is a plus.
Little bit of ADHD stimulation while working on other things simultaneously. Right amount of hands-on to not require too much effort, but enough to give it minimal mechanics.

A very slow game, as most idles are. pretty steady journey to getting a perfect game if that's what you are aiming for all the achievements can be met just from popping in regularly and letting it run for an hour or two depending on you're pace. I just go back every now and then when I remember about this game and usually get a new achievement each time.
There are fish, cats and it is afk. Great game.

Very addicting and fun game to play while you play another game, study, eat, etc. I had a lot of fun maxing out the dishes and getting all of the achievements. I would say this is worth the price if you tend to be busy and get up from your desk a lot.
Super fun just to put on in the backround and cats... 10/10
Great game, i love how it sits in the background and my family all jump on the computer to have ago randomly

A very cozy and cute game which won't punish you (heavily) for forgetting about it for six hours straight, cough cough. It's still being developed/updated, there is free holiday content, it has cats... what's not to love?

I actually love it. Its perfect for little breaks or just idling and there is more than just fishing, in the opposite to most others of this idle games. You have the fishing, the sushi bar, the breeding and your own little aquarium. For that price, its definitively worth it.

Just 100% this one :)
I love idlers for when I'm working and this was a really cute one!
It's a true idler for the most part and just sits at the bottom of your screen. Your typing/clicking increases catch rate of your rods and there's plenty of maps, fishes to get, rod upgrades, and dishes to upgrade.
It hatches fish offline and your aquarium collects money offline as well.
My only gripe, albeit a small one, is there's not a lot of customization for your pier or boat. Like tables/rugs etc.
Worth the price though for something to occasionally check on and progress.

Fish to Dish was a really nice suprise for me!
It's a cute idler and pretty chill to vibe along when working or multi tasking
This little gem was a nice companion for a few weeks :)
I will probably revisit it later to finish achievements ^_^

Weirdly addictive idle game. Been enjoying it for three days while I do other things and it's very satisfying. Being a fish obsessed grim reaper with a skull cat is pretty sweet.
Great idle and fishing game, nice art and progression ramps nicely.

This game is top tier when it comes to idle games! So much to do and many hours spent unlocking and enjoying every pixel! Plenty of equipment upgrading, map exploring, sushi making, and more to be had! I need more levels, dishes, and fishes!
A fun idle game to just relax with while playing or doing other things.
Best idle game (so far) for digital artist. The move of pen tip of pen tablet can be caught.

I like the game a lot and am going to get all the achievements, but it could use more upgrade options.  I really was expecting being able to get multiple fishermen on the boat.  Also more chefs and waitstaff!  Still for what it is it's a fun time killer.  I hope they add more to it but I won't get my hopes up.

It's a simple idle game that I find myself turning on just to have the little boat on my second monitor. It has just enough 'game' to it where I can decorate the sushi bar as I like, or work towards breeding variants, or watch my favorite catches swim in the aquarium I decorated to keep it engaging. I'm not sure if once I've unlocked everything that it will continue to hold my interest, but so far after almost 200 hours of using it I have plenty of things to still unlock.

Neat little idle game to keep running in the background while you do other things.  125 hours in and nearing in on most of the achievements.  Sadly once all the achievements are had, I see little reason to continue the game other than just to watch it do its thing at the bottom of your screen.

If you‚Äôve ever wanted to watch a guy catch fish ‚Äî this is your game. 
If you‚Äôve ever wanted to see someone make sushi ‚Äî this is your game. 
Love cats? This is your game. 
Dream of having your very own orca? Yep, this is your game. 
Want a hassle‚Äëfree fish tank? This is definitely your game. 
And if you enjoy all of the above layered beautifully over your anime wallpaper‚Ä¶ this is absolutely your game.

Final verdict: 9/10 ‚Äî wonderfully calm, delightfully fishy. üêü‚ú®
Relaxing background game.  Pay attention to it.  Ignore it.  A true idler with soothing mechanics and music

Downloaded this one with about 9 other desktop companion games available and it's competing for the best one I've found. 29 hours in or so 30/93 achievements. (worth the 15 bucks). Very well made and the concept works for a great game play loop.
Completely worth the price. Cute. Easy to disassociate into after a long day of work.. or to just have it sitting on your screen to watch and relax. Also cats! Not much more to say <3

If you have heard of the game Dave the Diver. This game is similar minus the underwater hunting aspect. I thoroughly enjoyed my time playing this game especially with its little details. The interactive little window for when I'm "studying", many secrets located in each map, the variety of dishes to upgrade and the [spoiler]Big Chonker that does his little dance[/spoiler]. Looking forward for future updates!!

a decent addition to the 'bottom of your screen' genre, more idle than active compared to most others, great for those who enjoy having something running while doing other things and using it to take short breaks.... will take hundreds of hours to complete all achievements

Wah... Such a smol relaxing idle fishing game.. 
- Great Music
- Great Gameplay (idle)
- Desktop friendly
- Collect-a-thon fish album
- Fish rarity 
- Great levels

So it's basically combining dave the diver with idle clicker's leveling element with super relaxing music and desktop friendly game element like bongo cat and wallpaper engine. What's not to love?

Btw, thanks V for the game!

The absolute perfect game for the working gamer.  So many goodies stuffed into a game that is such a small price.  Fishing, breeding, upgrades, food prep, clothing choices, collecting - collecting & more collecting !  Also, the fact that clicking & typing outside of the game boosts the catches is chef's kiss !

A really fun, fishing/business sim, not bad for an idle game that sits at the bottom of your screen while you do other things and you can check in on it get your fish, make sushi for your sushi place and watch customers come and go eating your sushi, you have an aquarium that earns you money per hour, a hatchery to breed fish and an interesting mechanic that gives you variants from fry you get. VERY fun little chill game with surprisingly a lot to do, plus upgrading your poles and boats and adding more poles and OH my GOD this game is so fun, just get it.

This is like if Dave the Diver was an idle game. It's a nice little productivity game to have in the background, and interesting enough to devote some attention to once you have a moment. It's a good little game.

Amazing game to have run in the background that gives you a good sense of constant progress.

One of my favorite idle games to date.
The pace isn't something to dread and everything has been coded with love. There are a variety of customization options and hidden map features to interact with for achievements. I would recommend for anyone.

Great idle game to have running while you're doing other things on your computer! When you're wanting to give it a bit of attention there's always something to do and doesn't feel like you have to just leave it and wait like other idle games. Going for a 100% achievements doesn't appear hard (in the process, will come back and update once I have it) and I just like fishing. Super fun, super cute, I enjoy all the designs of the fish as well!

its a great game to have playing in the back, its and entertainig but wont demand your full atention.
its very afordabel for what it is and fun. may favorite part is trying to max out every sea.
My favorite desktop idler.  Very relaxing, very cute, makes me want sushi.

Actually, it‚Äôs pretty good. It‚Äôs perfect for idling.
If you‚Äôre looking for something more interactive, I wouldn‚Äôt go with this one.
Your fisherman catches fish, your restaurant sells sushi, you earn money and fish, and upgrade things.
It‚Äôs simple, pretty straightforward, and easy to pick up.
The aesthetic is cute and comfy.
hands down one of the best idle games. don't have to do too much and me clicking on any screen counts which is fun.
A fat cat showed up at my sushi bar. Getting him 5 fish took a bit, but the dance he did and the achievement 'Big Chonker' were 100% worth it. Will feed every fat cat anything they want.
Best idle game out there. Super Chill. Fish. Idle. Prosper.
Rekindled my love for sushi and made me spend way too much money on it. 11/10 would recommend
Super cute, very chill. Great to have in the background.
Its a cute Idle game thats just fun and cozy
Fun and chill idle game. And fish.
This has become one of my most favorite games. Would love a bit of steam deck support!

love it. 
fish, yes.
cats? yes.
pixelart, yes.
this is just adhd love on your off-screen
i love this idle game it the best idle game i own buy it you wouldn't regret it
11/10 game, good to just chill and fish.
Very relaxed game play plenty of things to idle! lol
An awesome Idle game to have running in the background! Well worth it!
It's the perfect level of distraction from school/work compared to many other idle games.

I have been enjoying this way more than I anticipated! 
You probably need this game in your life.
wish they include more fish but its was ok overall
chill game needs more updates n shi tho
nice for writers :)
chill fish idler game
Good fun casual game
Way more fun than I expected.
Very chill and cute game!
Chill game while working
very nice chill idle game
Cute little idle game.
Excellent chill game
Very fun Idle game
Fish to Dish. its in the name
Cute cozy game.
Nice idle game !!!
great game i love it
game of the year 2025
Good game
good
Fun idle game
v fun idle game
it's pretty good
it's p. good!
Get what you pay for
Amazing timekiller
Goodd
fish then dish, simple
Fishie clicker
Veri fahn. yes indeed
cats!!
Simple and pure idle
ÈíìÈ±º Â•ΩÁé©
It's a gem
i lobe fishing
delicious desktop slop
haha classic
Just fish
DAWDADAD
Cats
I like this one.
Chill...
NICE

negative.review: Honestly, not thrilled.  It's cute, but it's frustratingly empty.  There's a bare loop of get fish, upgrade meals, sell meals, get money and buy better rods to repeat the loop.  It checks the boxes but it's not that fun even when it's all running smoothly.  The upgrades are not exciting, the shop is not exciting, it doesn't even satisfy being really cute on the bottom of the screen enough.  I've played a fair chunk of idlers at this point, and I say pass on this unless the theme is absolutely something you need.

Don't be like me. I despise these low-effort, bottom-of-the-screen idlers. They are "en vogue" and they are horrible. Kinda sucks but that's the FoTM and these are cheap and easy to make so they will be abundant.

I was really excited for a ripoff of Dave the Diver and this was close but ... idk... I just don't want this type of game but I'll keep it cuz being a $6 banner to future morons like myself feels worthwhile.

They tricked me with the nice backgrounds but I missed the thumbnails like a fool.... my fault. Congratulations to them for tricking me out of a few dollars. 

Just make it a full screen game. I legit DO NOT understand this recent trend but it's awful. I don't wanna see my desktop in the background... why would I want that? Why is this the new thing?

Honestly, not thrilled.  It's cute, but it's frustratingly empty.  There's a bare loop of get fish, upgrade meals, sell meals, get money and buy better rods to repeat the loop.  It checks the boxes but it's not that fun even when it's all running smoothly.  The upgrades are not exciting, the shop is not exciting, it doesn't even satisfy being really cute on the bottom of the screen enough.  I've played a fair chunk of idlers at this point, and I say pass on this unless the theme is absolutely something you need.

Fish to Dish: Idle Sushi is a semi-idle, click-based, collection game. 

Over the course of several unique maps, you will attempt to fish up several sets of: common, uncommon, rare, epic, and legendary fish. You use this fish to complete your bestiary and menu, which can be displayed in your aquarium and restaurant respectively to generate gold. Gold is used to purchase upgrades such as: Improved Rods, Improved Bait, Cats that collect your fish, the size of your aquarium, the size of your fish hatchery, and Improved hatchery feed. It can also be used to purchase cosmetic upgrades, and the various maps. 

With the basics of the game established, please let me explain my frustration, and why I don‚Äôt particularly recommend it based on my taste. Your's may differ, so that context is important because I think this is actually not too bad of a game. I think about games like this in terms of Steam Achievements and how close am I to completing 100% of them. For example, early game is roughly 0-45% achievements completed, middle is roughly 45-80% completion and late game is 80% and up. 

In the early part of the game, you have to spend a lot of time clicking through if you want to progress into the bigger upgrades quickly. You can passively earn gold but its light and would take a few days if not weeks of daily check-ins. As you progress into the middle part of the game, things start to get automated. Your hatchery doesn‚Äôt need manual refilling anymore and neither does your bait, so realistically you can generate however much you need. It starts to take a second to do anything but it's realistically still pretty achievable under 100 hours. Late game takes some time to get to and it's potentially infinite to finish. You should finish upgrading, the bestiary, and the cooking menu right around 100-140 hours. That part's fine. Even the cats one where you have to go back and collect random fish they want isn‚Äôt that bad and I‚Äôm sure the gold one is only another dozen hours or so...HOWEVER...

...Every single map has an achievement that requires you to actively watch\click until you win the Random Number Generator (RNG) prize. 

It starts off as like a starfish or a seal, you click it, it disappears, something else pops up a few minutes later. You'll notice pretty quickly though, you start to see a lot of a particular shade of starfish, or a very familiar seal, when the achievement wants a penguin. I never saw the penguin though, also, it only gives you gold anyway so its literally just for the achievement. I‚Äôm nearly 140 hours in, every upgrade and collectible is unlocked and I still need pretty much every single one from every single map. 

So at this point its not really an idle game anymore because I have to actively watch and click through to increase my odds of finding it before it hit 500+ hours of game play, and that's just not it for me. Plus all my upgrades are now useless because I can't buy anything else so its just ringing for no reason. It just doesn't feel great. 

Anyway that's where I'm at with this. I liked it enough to play 140 hours but I'm all really frustrated that I might have to double or triple that in order to get an RNG based set of achievements. It also kind of invalidates all of the progress you make on finishing the restaurant and aquarium because the only thing left to spend gold on is cosmetics you can't use AND that particular aspect of game play literally isn't touched by any of the upgrades!!! Its just clicking and luck which felt terrible. 

Cheers!

Don't be like me. I despise these low-effort, bottom-of-the-screen idlers. They are "en vogue" and they are horrible. Kinda sucks but that's the FoTM and these are cheap and easy to make so they will be abundant.

I was really excited for a ripoff of Dave the Diver and this was close but ... idk... I just don't want this type of game but I'll keep it cuz being a $6 banner to future morons like myself feels worthwhile.

They tricked me with the nice backgrounds but I missed the thumbnails like a fool.... my fault. Congratulations to them for tricking me out of a few dollars. 

Just make it a full screen game. I legit DO NOT understand this recent trend but it's awful. I don't wanna see my desktop in the background... why would I want that? Why is this the new thing?

Honestly, not thrilled.  It's cute, but it's frustratingly empty.  There's a bare loop of get fish, upgrade meals, sell meals, get money and buy better rods to repeat the loop.  It checks the boxes but it's not that fun even when it's all running smoothly.  The upgrades are not exciting, the shop is not exciting, it doesn't even satisfy being really cute on the bottom of the screen enough.  I've played a fair chunk of idlers at this point, and I say pass on this unless the theme is absolutely something you need.

So at this point its not really an idle game anymore because I have to actively watch and click through to increase my odds of finding it before it hit 500+ hours of game play, and that's just not it for me. Plus all my upgrades are now useless because I can't buy anything else so its just ringing for no reason. It just doesn't feel great. 

Anyway that's where I'm at with this. I liked it enough to play 140 hours but I'm all really frustrated that I might have to double or triple that in order to get an RNG based set of achievements. It also kind of invalidates all of the progress you make on finishing the restaurant and aquarium because the only thing left to spend gold on is cosmetics you can't use AND that particular aspect of game play literally isn't touched by any of the upgrades!!! Its just clicking and luck which felt terrible. 

Cheers!

Don't be like me. I despise these low-effort, bottom-of-the-screen idlers. They are "en vogue" and they are horrible. Kinda sucks but that's the FoTM and these are cheap and easy to make so they will be abundant.

I was really excited for a ripoff of Dave the Diver and this was close but ... idk... I just don't want this type of game but I'll keep it cuz being a $6 banner to future morons like myself feels worthwhile.

They tricked me with the nice backgrounds but I missed the thumbnails like a fool.... my fault. Congratulations to them for tricking me out of a few dollars. 

Just make it a full screen game. I legit DO NOT understand this recent trend but it's awful. I don't wanna see my desktop in the background... why would I want that? Why is this the new thing?

Honestly, not thrilled.  It's cute, but it's frustratingly empty.  There's a bare loop of get fish, upgrade meals, sell meals, get money and buy better rods to repeat the loop.  It checks the boxes but it's not that fun even when it's all running smoothly.  The upgrades are not exciting, the shop is not exciting, it doesn't even satisfy being really cute on the bottom of the screen enough.  I've played a fair chunk of idlers at this point, and I say pass on this unless the theme is absolutely something you need.

Fish to Dish: Idle Sushi is a semi-idle, click-based, collection game. 

Over the course of several unique maps, you will attempt to fish up several sets of: common, uncommon, rare, epic, and legendary fish. You use this fish to complete your bestiary and menu, which can be displayed in your aquarium and restaurant respectively to generate gold. Gold is used to purchase upgrades such as: Improved Rods, Improved Bait, Cats that collect your fish, the size of your aquarium, the size of your fish hatchery, and Improved hatchery feed. It can also be used to purchase cosmetic upgrades, and the various maps. 

With the basics of the game established, please let me explain my frustration, and why I don‚Äôt particularly recommend it based on my taste. Your's may differ, so that context is important because I think this is actually not too bad of a game. I think about games like this in terms of Steam Achievements and how close am I to completing 100% of them. For example, early game is roughly 0-45% achievements completed, middle is roughly 45-80% completion and late game is 80% and up. 

In the early part of the game, you have to spend a lot of time clicking through if you want to progress into the bigger upgrades quickly. You can passively earn gold but its light and would take a few days if not weeks of daily check-ins. As you progress into the middle part of the game, things start to get automated. Your hatchery doesn‚Äôt need manual refilling anymore and neither does your bait, so realistically you can generate however much you need. It starts to take a second to do anything but it's realistically still pretty achievable under 100 hours. Late game takes some time to get to and it's potentially infinite to finish. You should finish upgrading, the bestiary, and the cooking menu right around 100-140 hours. That part's fine. Even the cats one where you have to go back and collect random fish they want isn‚Äôt that bad and I‚Äôm sure the gold one is only another dozen hours or so...HOWEVER...

...Every single map has an achievement that requires you to actively watch\click until you win the Random Number Generator (RNG) prize. 

It starts off as like a starfish or a seal, you click it, it disappears, something else pops up a few minutes later. You'll notice pretty quickly though, you start to see a lot of a particular shade of starfish, or a very familiar seal, when the achievement wants a penguin. I never saw the penguin though, also, it only gives you gold anyway so its literally just for the achievement. I‚Äôm nearly 140 hours in, every upgrade and collectible is unlocked and I still need pretty much every single one from every single map. 

So at this point its not really an idle game anymore because I have to actively watch and click through to increase my odds of finding it before it hit 500+ hours of game play, and that's just not it for me. Plus all my upgrades are now useless because I can't buy anything else so its just ringing for no reason. It just doesn't feel great. 

Anyway that's where I'm at with this. I liked it enough to play 140 hours but I'm all really frustrated that I might have to double or triple that in order to get an RNG based set of achievements. It also kind of invalidates all of the progress you make on finishing the restaurant and aquarium because the only thing left to spend gold on is cosmetics you can't use AND that particular aspect of game play literally isn't touched by any of the upgrades!!! Its just clicking and luck which felt terrible. 

Cheers!
